image.altText: A woman whose face is blurred holds a baby. The baby is looking up at her face with his mouth open and arms out.

props.synopsis: Maria thought she was doing the right thing by connecting with the sperm donor she used to conceive her baby. She now wants the clinic to warn other families.

title.children: Maria used a sperm donor to have her son. Then he tracked her down

image.altText: A graphic shows a drawing of a house, next to a set of keys, against a yellow background.

props.synopsis: House-sitting platforms are connecting sitters and home owners for a fee. But who's responsible when things go wrong?

title.children: 'No-one is watching. Just go skinny-dipping': House-sitting platforms have a security camera problem

image.altText: Joe Biden and Donald Trump stand far apart on a blue stage in front of a masked audience.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump will meet on a debate stage for the first of two televised face-offs that could prove critical in their tight rematch race to win the White House in November. Here's what to know ahead of the debate.

title.children: The first Biden vs Trump presidential debate of 2024: Where to watch and what to expect

image.altText: Hands hold a mobile phone displaying a scam text message

props.synopsis: A new registry could make it mandatory for texts to disclose a sender ID in the latest crackdown by the government on SMS text scammers.

title.children: Sick of getting scam texts? A new registry could help differentiate legitimate texts from scams

image.altText: a male customer stands waiting at a pharmacy counter

props.synopsis: Priceline, TerryWhite Chemmart, Chemist Warehouse and other major pharmacy chains reject new vaping laws making them the only legal sellers of vapes, signalling to franchisees they should not sell the products without a prescription.

title.children: Priceline, TerryWhite Chemmart and other major brands reject vape laws, despite becoming exclusive retailers

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's new deputy governor plays down this week's inflation surprise, saying there is plenty of economic data between now and the bank's next interest rate meeting in August.

title.children: 'Bad mistake to set policy on one number': RBA deputy plays down this week's inflation shock

image.altText: red, white and blue jet on the tarmac in Broome

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed that a 22-year-old man has died in a light plane crash in South Australia's far north. The man was the pilot and sole occupant of the aircraft.

title.children: 22-year-old man dies in light plane crash in South Australia's far north, another seriously injured in separate crash

image.altText: A young girl with dark black hair, wearing jeans and a denim jacket, sits cross legged and smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A spurned lover who abducted, bound and buried his former girlfriend alive in a shallow grave has had his non-parole period for murder extended by more than five years.

title.children: Man who kidnapped and killed ex-lover will stay behind bars for five more years

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: In a major legal milestone for Operation Ironside cases around the country, SA's Court of Appeal rules millions of messages sent and received across the encrypted AN0M — which was deliberately placed by police in the hands of alleged criminals — were lawfully obtained.

title.children: Millions of messages via AN0M app were lawfully obtained, court rules

image.altText: A close up of an older woman wearing a black chef's hat and apron reading 'Nonna's Cucina'

props.synopsis: The court heard Francesco Dimasi, 92, was bed-ridden and suffering dementia and would not be entering a plea to one count of murder "at all, based on mental fitness".

title.children: Accused wife-killer allegedly inflicted '76 sharp force injuries' when he stabbed her to death, court hears

image.altText: Dustin Martin pumps his fist and yells in delight

props.synopsis: Player salaries in the AFL will grow massively in the coming seasons, as those in the millionaires club welcome new members due to more money pouring into the game.

title.children: How one of the AFL's most exclusive clubs is set to explode in membership

image.altText: Kevin Rudd and Julian Assange

props.synopsis: Australia's Ambassador to the United States Kevin Rudd says he "couldn't possibly comment" on whether he encouraged Julian Assange and his team to accept a plea deal with the US.

title.children: 'Your term, not mine,' Kevin Rudd says on whether he was 'linchpin' in Julian Assange's plea deal

image.altText: An advertisment for gummy mushrooms

props.synopsis: An urgent recall is issued for Uncle Frog mushroom gummies after consumers around the country are hospitalised with serious health symptoms including hallucinations and seizures.

title.children: 'I'm quite traumatised by the whole thing': Mushroom gummies recalled after more than eight people hospitalised

image.altText: A Chinese military official wearing a military jacket with medals

props.synopsis: China's former defence minister Li Shangfu faces prosecution after provoking the ire of Xi Jinping's Communist Party which accuses him of causing "enormous damage" through political graft crimes.

title.children: Chinese Communist Party expels former defence minister over alleged 'pernicious' graft crimes

image.altText: person walking surrounded by tear gas

props.synopsis: Kenyan police have fired rubber bullets and tear gas at protesters, as they return to the streets despite President William Ruto scrapping a finance bill following deadly protests across the country this week.

title.children: Kenya police fire rubber bullets, tear gas at protestors who returned to streets despite bill withdrawal

image.altText: A group of rugby league players look upset after losing a game

props.synopsis: The Blues never got started, a Maroons legend never stopped and Queensland claimed the first ever women's State of Origin decider. Here's five quick hits from the epic clash in Townsville.

title.children: Five quick hits: a horror start, an ageless wonder and some kicking brilliance won the women's Origin for Queensland

image.altText: Queensland Maroons players lift the Women's State of Origin shield.

props.synopsis: The Women's State of Origin shield will stay in Queensland for another 12 months after the Maroons scored a comprehensive win over the Blues in the decider in Townsville.

title.children: Maroons lift the shield after masterclass in historic Women's State of Origin decider

image.altText: A grey-haired Greek-Australian man, smiles in front of a juice press

props.synopsis: Residents in one of Australia's largest citrus growing regions are buying up bottles of a locally-produced juice as its creator shuts down after 31 years.

title.children: A microbiologist dreamt of making the best juice. His community is stocking up as production ends

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay $2 million to Network Ten over his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann ordered to pay $2 million to Network Ten over failed defamation case

image.altText: Scam victim Lee Braz on motorbike.

props.synopsis: Lee fought the financial ombudsman all the way to the federal court when scammers stole his super. Despite winning he only got some money back and after legal fees he's worse off.

title.children: 'Worked 40 years for nothing': Scammers tricked Lee's super fund and stole 180k

image.altText: wind farm hero option b

props.synopsis: Developers say the proposed 100 turbine farm to be built near Collie, outside the town of Moodiarrup, will produce enough electricity to power the Perth CBD.

title.children: Hundred-turbine wind farm to be built 55km from proposed Coalition nuclear power plant site

image.altText: An office building showing a politician in a suit reading Tim Crakanthorp MP on the glass windows

props.synopsis: A court has heard a 19-year-old Newcastle man allegedly found with weapons and tactical equipment intended to kill New South Wales MP Tim Crakanthorp.

title.children: Man charged with terrorism offence allegedly intended to kill Newcastle MP, court hears

image.altText: Toutai Kefu arrives at the Supreme Court of Queensland in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The teens — who cannot legally be identified — were originally charged with the attempted murder of Mr Kefu, his wife Rachel Kefu and their two adult children in August 2021.

title.children: 'Just stab them': Teens who attacked rugby great Toutai Kefu and his family in their home sentenced

image.altText: A middle-aged white man with white hair in a suit walks out of court surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: While we have no idea how Julian Assange is coping from being cooped up inside for so long with few visitors, we do know that isolation can have a severe negative impact on many people.

title.children: Julian Assange was isolated for more than a decade. Here's what that does to the body and mind

image.altText: The six politicians stand in front of the US Capitol building.

props.synopsis: A cross-party delegation of jet-lagged and obstinate Australian parliamentarians arrived in Washington DC last September to advocate for Julian Assange's freedom. Those in the room reflect on how the "robust", and at times "aggressive", meeting went.

title.children: 'There was an attempt to brush us away': How six Australian MPs took the cause of Julian Assange to Washington

image.altText: Albanese at the lectern has both hands in the air, waving to the room, as photographers take pictures

props.synopsis: The electoral cycle rollercoaster has Labor holding on for dear life, with the federal party going through its lowest of ebbs this term.

title.children: As voters look forward to cost-of-living relief coming next week, they're not the only ones getting a pay rise

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Neighbours told the Supreme Court in Wagga Wagga that Ms Haigh did not want Robert Geeves on her son's birth certificate "due to how [he] treated her".

title.children: Murder trial hears Amber Haigh did not want accused's name on son's birth certificate

image.altText: a galaxy above a dark strip of land over the sea

props.synopsis: Just 30 kilometres north of a bustling CBD but surrounded by national parks, Palm Beach headland has been given the nod by the DarkSky International organisation.

title.children: The Sydney stargazing spot globally recognised for its dark night skies

image.altText: a young man in a white robe leads a procession of priests through a Catholic church

props.synopsis: A Melbourne church is defying the Pope with a centuries-old service in a dead language. Why are so many young Catholics travelling hours to get there?

title.children: 'Zoomers want authenticity': These young Catholics are choosing a dead language over a modernising Pope

image.altText: Man with glasses

props.synopsis: Teacher and former NRL player Keith Eshman has told a court he did not sexually assault a young girl on multiple occasions.

title.children: School teacher asked about Google search history after denying child abuse

image.altText: A man sits at a desk holding a piece of paper in a warehouse. In front of him are several large munitions.

props.synopsis: The Defence Department has asked the National Anti-Corruption Commission to investigate the awarding of a $1.2 billion contract to a French-owned weapons company after the auditor-general found evidence of "unethical conduct".

title.children: One-billion-dollar Thales defence contract referred to national corruption watchdog

image.altText: Socceroos

props.synopsis: Australia will face the likes of Japan in the third Asian qualifying round for the 2026 men's World Cup as they chase a sixth straight appearance at the tournament.

title.children: Socceroos learn 2026 World Cup qualifying fate

image.altText: Marilyn Monroe lays on her stomach on a lawn, smiling into the distance as she rests her chin on her right hand

props.synopsis: Marilyn Monroe's home will not be demolished after the LA City Council deems the property a historical landmark, thwarting the plans of neighbours to expand their estate.

title.children: Home where Marilyn Monroe lived and died avoids demolition after being deemed a historical landmark

image.altText: Michael Sukkar wears a suit with a red tie.

props.synopsis: Shadow Minister for Housing Michael Sukkar says the number overseas arrivals since Labor came to power is four times greater than the number of houses built. RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Are overseas arrivals outpacing housing construction at a rate of four to one?

image.altText: An AI-generated image of a robot wearing headphones and playing a keyboard in a music studio, with speakers behind it

props.synopsis: The use of artificial intelligence is on the rise but some of the biggest record companies in the world believe AI is marching to the beat of its own drum.

title.children: Here are five quick facts about why US record companies are suing AI song-generators
